file_content.text: What a gray nonagon that was. Here's hoping I don't live to see another.
Take that shuttle down to Asation. We're up to our eyeballs in blue scalenes and yellow spheres!
I thought we'd had it, Chancellor. That Trandoshan might as well have been made of durasteel, and that hypergate just kept spewing machines and beasties....
Excuse me, Major. Machines? Beasties? Perhaps you're not quite recovered from your exertions in the field.
Here's your handpicked squad now. Maybe they can explain it better than I can.
No need to take my word for it. Our Jedi friend can explain everything. I hope.
Well, Havoc Squad led the charge. Better let their commander brief you instead.
Looks like your privateer's found her way back. Maybe ask her what happened.
Looks like your privateer's found his way back. Maybe ask him what happened.
Welcome. I hear you're to be congratulated. Kephess is dead, the hypergate is closed, and our Gree allies on Asation are safe.
The Gree are too special to be wiped out by mindless beasts.
Glad to hear it.
I'm pleased you think so. They seem to have taken quite a liking to you, too.
I rarely get the chance to tackle such... unique challenges.
I enjoyed myself.
I'm certain there will be others. The galaxy is a unique and dangerous place.
Ground's secure and the situation's normal. The Gree can handle things from here.
Affirmative.
Once you've been around the galaxy a few times, you learn how to handle the unexpected.
It was nothing.
I still don't know what a green perpendicular is, but I think I killed a lot of them.
If you say so.
You and me both, friend.
The next time the Gree need help, maybe you should handpick someone else.
Never doing that again.
Considering the outcome, I think my judgment was sound enough.
We've been in contact with Gatemaster Beltek'k. He's very grateful for your assistance and wants to present you with a reward. Of sorts.
The Gree owe me nothing. Closing the hypergate helped us all.
That's not necessary.
You deserve this honor, Master Jedi. We couldn't have done it without you.
Please tell the gatemaster that I would be honored to accept.
How kind of him.
I don't think he was going to take "no" for an answer.
Why not? I think my dress uniform's got room for another medal.
Fine with me.
Our war against the Empire has only just begun. I'm certain there will be many more.
Time to bring out some of that sweet, sweet Gree technology.
Jackpot!
I'm not sure how... material a reward they have in mind.
Did the gatemaster say what this reward is, exactly?
Meaning what?
Major Cobus and I were unable to translate, but he seemed very enthusiastic.
I can't take much more colorful geometry, Chancellor.
Do I have to?
I insist. Victory over the Empire will depend on our alliance with the Gree--and whatever technology they are willing to share.
Most agreeable salutations, Republic bisectors. From Crafter to Administrator, all castes are aware of Asation's perpetuation.
Without rapid battle-aid-response, this would have been unattainable. What purple tangent your arrival has been!
We must aggrandize you for your efforts. We have made a promulgation to all Gree: You are red rhombus. Felicitations!
It was my pleasure, Gatemaster. I hope Asation will recover from this.
Thank you.
With further collaboration from our Republic bisectors, all will be orange sphere soon.
I'm sorry, Gatemaster. I'm not sure what that means... or how I should feel.
Red rhombus?
Be purple parallel, little sentient! You are absolute, unequaled, without defect!
Great. Purple perpendicular to you, too. Can I leave now?
Oh, brother.
It is most complaisant of you to attempt Gree articulation. Your inaccuracies are delightful!
We have never designated red rhombus without the Ritual of Blue Vertex. We will begin this observance now....
...finally, white equilateral! We thank you for your allotment of minutes, Republic bisectors. Farewell, red rhombus!
You should be honored. It doesn't translate well, but Gatemaster Beltek'k just gave you the highest title in Gree society.
I'm happy to help the Gree, red rhombus or not.
Still, not necessary.
I appreciate the act, even if I didn't fully understand it.
I am honored.
Kind of glad they didn't put all that on a medal.
Pretty long title.
At least I'll get free drinks in all the Gree cantinas.
Good enough for me.
Will the Gree be able to protect Asation on their own?
What happens now?
We won't leave the Gree to fend for themselves. We're allies for life now. That was the Republic's reward.
There's twenty minutes of my life I'll never get back.
That was pointless.
I'll note your distaste for honors and accolades in the future.
As long as we're handing out rewards, here's mine. Me and my boys never would have survived Asation if you hadn't shown up. Thanks.
The Republic is in your debt as well. We may never know why Kephess opened the hypergate, or what the Dread Masters were planning, but you stopped them here.
Wherever the Dread Masters may strike next, I hope we can call on you again. Until then, safe travels.
You'd better get down to the surface, and fast. My boys don't know a black bisector from a green perpendicular.
Enemy's closing in, Major. This thing's huge! It's got five--no, six arms! How should we proceed?
Stand by, Sergeant. Gatemaster, that creature's wiped out six squads already. Give me something I can use!
I regret I am not Warrior caste, Republic bisector. I am all yellow acute in this sphere. Perhaps additional bisectors?
There you are! The Supreme Chancellor said she was sending help. Do you know what any of this crazy math means?
He called you a bisector. Maybe you need to send reinforcements?
More men, I think?
You're my reinforcements. But we'll never get you down there in time--
Your guess is as good as mine, Major.
No idea.
Just... fall back! Retreat, Sergeant! Do you hear me? Retreat!
I was told Major Cobus was cool and calm under pressure.
You're falling apart.
I was cool and calm two weeks ago. Now I'm just trying to save my men--
It's too late! They're everywhere now... we're being torn apart... ahh!
Guess that's as good a way as any to start this briefing. I'm Major Cobus, in command of Republic forces on Asation.
The planet's been overrun by nasty things I don't even have a name for. They're all coming out of this portal the Gree call a hypergate.
This is Gatemaster Beltek'k. He was in charge of the hypergate before it opened up. I'll let him try and explain the rest.
The gatemaster and I can take it from here. Whatever "it" is.
Just relax, Major.
You Republic bisectors are so facilitating. I will attempt to be the same.
I have a hard time understanding the Gree language.
I'll try to listen.
I beg atonement. We find our adaptation most purple--most preferable to your own. I will attempt clarity.
I'm guessing "gatemaster" is more of an honorary title, then?
So this is his fault.
You misunderstand, Republic bisector. I will elucidate matters now.
Since the hypergate opened, only hostiles have emerged. Some are sentient, some automatons. Many Gree and Republic bisectors have been terminated.
My mortification is most acute. As gatemaster, defense of the hypergate is my first function. But I am Administrator caste--wholly unsuited to this task!
I'm sure you did as well as any other Administrator could have.
Don't blame yourself.
You are all blue obtuse, Republic bisector, but you do not comprehend our affliction.
What are these hypergates, exactly? What do they do?
I need more details.
The hypergates were constructed by our progenitors. They allow immediate egress from one sphere to another, but not in reverse.
The origination point of the Asation hypergate is unknown. It must be a yellow sphere indeed, for it has caused much dissolution.
Don't the Gree have soldiers or mercenaries or... anything?
You're right about that.
A Warrior caste has never been required. The Crafters built military units instead--an imprudent resolution!
Our military units are in disorder. They have rejected their directives and turned on their Operators. They were the only bisectors we possessed.
Now, the hypergate will never be closed. Asation will grow barren. The green perpendiculars will spread, and all will be yellow concave!
If a rogue droid army is the worst thing down there, we'll be fine.
I can handle it.
If that were only truth, Republic bisector. These perpendiculars are unlike any we have seen before.
Did you open the hypergate on purpose? Or was it an accident?
How did this happen?
Maybe you shouldn't have relied on droids to protect you.
That'll teach you.
Even now, our Crafters are disassembling units. But this is yellow tangent.
I did not administer the hypergate's opening. The causation of this event was all white convex until the Republic bisectors' arrival.
We reviewed the Gree droids' security recordings. Kephess--our old Trandoshan friend from Denova--was lurking around the hypergate.
Denova was intense. I can't believe he survived that fight.
Not him again.
From what I hear, he had some help. Some pretty unnatural, disturbing help.
I don't remember Kephess. Or Denova, for that matter.
Who's Kephess?
Mercenary. Republic hired him to protect our interests on Denova. Seemed to be working out, until he betrayed us.
What is Kephess hoping to achieve by attacking the Gree?
What are his motives?
You've fought one Trandoshan, you've fought them all.
I'm not scared.
Not like Kephess. This one's got some new implants and some powerful friends.
Kephess is working for the Dread Masters now--a group of rogue Sith trying to start their own Empire. Not sure how opening a hypergate helps.
The one you call Kephess is now perpendicular to the hypergate. He must be terminated, but we do not have bisectors capable of this.
Neither do I. My last squad of bisectors just got eaten by a six-armed beast.
The Supreme Chancellor said you were the best. I hope she's right, because you're the only shot the Gree have left.
I won't leave Asation until that hypergate is closed.
I won't fail you.
Your men won't have died in vain. I promise you that.
Take heart, Major.
Just give me your orders, Major, and I'll move out.
Understood.
I'm a great shot. A good-looking one, too.
She's very right.
Isn't there anyone left on Asation who can help?
So no backup?
If any of my men are still alive, they're just fighting to survive. You're on your own.
Time to pick up the Republic's slack again.
I can see that.
Well, I asked for the best. Next time I'll ask for someone nicer, too.
My expectations are heightened, Republic bisector. May there be infinite grey tangents along your path.
There's a shuttle prepped and ready to take you to Asation. Here's hoping we find those grey tangents soon.
Would someone please tell me what a grey nonagon is?
